contextId.information: Possible meanings are 1) this is simply a statement that the Spirit was in the form of a dove or 2) this is a simile that compares the Spirit coming down upon Jesus gently, the way a dove would. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
Jesus compares those who obey his words to a person who builds his house where nothing can harm it. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: like a wise man who built his house upon a rock

contextId.information: Jesus continues the simile from the previous verse. He compares those who do not obey his words to foolish house-builders. Only a fool would build a house on a sandy place where rain, floods, and wind can sweep the sand away. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: like a foolish man who built his house upon the sand

contextId.information: This simile means they did not have a leader to take care of them. AT: "The people did not have a leader" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: They were like sheep without a shepherd

contextId.information: Sheep are defenseless animals that wolves often attack. Jesus is stating that the people may harm the disciples. AT: "as sheep among people who are like dangerous wolves" or "as sheep among people who act the way dangerous animals act" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: as sheep in the midst of wolves

contextId.information: Jesus compares an ignorant person to a little child. Jesus is emphasizing that many of those who believe him are not well educated or think of themselves as wise. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
These are similes that emphasize how bright Jesus' appearance became. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: His face shone like the sun, and his garments became as brilliant as the light

contextId.information: Jesus compares the size of a mustard seed to the amount of faith needed to do a miracle. A mustard seed is very small, but it grows into a large plant. Jesus means it only takes a small amount of faith to do a great miracle. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: if you have faith even as small as a grain of mustard seed

contextId.information: Jesus uses a simile to teach the disciples that they should not be concerned with who is most important. They should be concerned with becoming humble like a child. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
This is a simile that means the scribes and Pharisees may appear to be pure on the outside, but they are wicked on the inside. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: you are like whitewashed tombs ... unclean

contextId.information: This means the Son of Man will come very fast and he will be easy to see. (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
contextId.quote: as the lightning shines ... so will be the coming

contextId.information: This is a simile that emphasizes how bright in appearance the angel was. AT: "was bright like lightning" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
This is a simile that means the soldiers fell down and did not move. AT: "and fell to the ground and lay there like dead men" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_simile]])
